title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco, 26, and Brandon Baez, 23, were sentenced for stealing checks from USPS collection boxes and bank fraud.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and $12,528 restitution; Baez got two years and $10,285 restitution.
The scheme involved washing checks with chemicals and depositing them into accounts controlled by the perpetrators.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen detained by ICE, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained in May 2025 as part of a "collateral arrest" while ICE targeted his father.
Gomes' arrest sparked community protests and highlighted concerns over the U.S. immigration system.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed regrettable goals, including one from center ice, in Team USA's win over Denmark at the Olympics.
Swayman humorously noted his colorblindness to deflect theories blaming rink conditions for his poor performance.
Despite Swayman's struggle with 18 saves, Team USA's strong offense led to victory against Denmark in Olympic play.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: NBA stars Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony anticipate Jayson Tatum's return from an Achilles injury could impact the NBA season.
Jayson Tatum has increased his practice activity, and a return could help the Celtics' playoff prospects with Jaylen Brown.
Durant and Anthony highlight Tatum's potential influence on the Celtics, suggesting his return is imminent and could scare the league.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to pursue free agents for positions of need this offseason.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are key targets for the Patriots' offensive improvements.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips fit Patriots’ future positional strategies.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes the new streaming home for MLB.TV, costing $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers as an add-on.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can access MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers renew automatically and can stream games on both MLB and ESPN apps after linkage.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his potential return from an Achilles injury.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. noted Tatum looked like himself in the G League practice session.
No timetable for Tatum's return has been given, though he's been participating in scrimmages with coaches.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, with nearly 22% having an advanced degree.
Vermont and Maryland were second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, tied to Massachusetts, is up for auction, closing on February 21.
The Wagner card, once owned by Morton Bernstein, has been kept by the family for 116 years and is ungraded.
Auction bid for the card is $3.9M, with a potential sale price of $4.758M, including buyer's premium.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman, Bruins goalie, will make his Olympic debut starting for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman went 5-0 in the 2025 IIHF World Championship, helping Team USA win by defeating Switzerland in the finals.
Team USA, featuring Bruins' Swayman and McAvoy, plays Denmark on Saturday and Germany on Sunday in preliminary rounds.
